greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1)=1; a(n)= sum(p \ n, a(p-1)), where sum is over all primes p that divide n, with multiplicity.
link: Joerg Arndt, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(1) = 1 and a(n) = A064415(n) for n>=2. [_Joerg Arndt_, Apr 08 2014]
mathematica: Fold[Append[#1, Total@ Table[#1[[p - 1]], {p, Flatten@ Map[ConstantArray[#1, #2] & @@ # &, FactorInteger[#2]]}]] &, {1}, Range[2, 105]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Dec 11 2017 *)
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Apr 20 2000
